member.name: T:NAnt.NUnit1.Tasks.NUnitTask
member.summary: Runs tests using the NUnit V1.0 framework.

remarks.para: See the NUnit home page for more information.
The or attributes are only used to stop more than one test suite to stop running. If any test suite fails a build error will be thrown. Set to to ignore test errors and continue build.

example.para: Run tests in the MyProject.Tests.dll assembly.
The test results are logged in results.xml and results.txt using the and formatters, respectively.
example.code: <nunit basedir="build" verbose="false" haltonerror="true" haltonfailure="true"> <formatter type="Xml" /> <formatter type="Plain" /> <test name="MyProject.Tests.AllTests" assembly="MyProject.Tests.dll" outfile="results"/> </nunit>

member.name: P:NAnt.NUnit1.Tasks.NUnitTask.HaltOnError
member.summary: Stops running tests when a test causes an error. The default is .

member.name: P:NAnt.NUnit1.Tasks.NUnitTask.HaltOnFailure
member.summary: Stops running tests if a test fails (errors are considered failures as well). The default is .

member.name: P:NAnt.NUnit1.Tasks.NUnitTask.Timeout
member.summary: Cancel the individual tests if they do not finish in the specified time (measured in milliseconds). Ignored if fork is disabled.

member.name: P:NAnt.NUnit1.Tasks.NUnitTask.Tests
member.summary: Tests to run.

member.name: P:NAnt.NUnit1.Tasks.NUnitTask.FormatterElements
member.summary: Formatters to output results of unit tests.

member.summary: Represents a test element of an .

member.summary: Run the tests in a separate .

member.summary: Stop the build process if an error occurs during the test run.

member.name: P:NAnt.NUnit1.Types.NUnitTest.HaltOnFailure
member.summary: Stop the build process if a test fails (errors are considered failures as well).

member.name: M:NAnt.NUnit1.Tasks.NUnitTestRunner.NeedsRunning
member.summary: Determines if the unit test needs running.
member.returns: if unit test needs running, otherwise, .

remarks.para: Determines if the test needs running by looking at the date stamp of the test assembly and the test results log.
